messages.content: What is the appropriate code to use to log a partial parotidectomy in which you perform an extracapsular dissection?

**What is the appropriate code to use to log a partial parotidectomy in which you perform an extracapsular dissection?**

A partial parotidectomy involving an extracapsular dissection refers to the surgical removal of part of the parotid gland, one of the major salivary glands located in front of and just below the ear. The extracapsular dissection specifically means that the surgery involves removing tissue outside the capsule of the parotid gland, typically aimed at excising tumors or other pathological tissues while preserving as much healthy tissue as possible.

**No specific CPT codes found in our database for this query.**
Please try rephrasing with more specific ENT procedure terminology.

**Coding Guidance:**
- Select the code that most accurately describes the specific procedure performed
- Check if any modifiers apply (e.g., -50 for bilateral procedures)
- Ensure documentation in the medical record supports the selected code

*All CPT codes provided are directly verified from our CPT code database.*

The extracapsular dissection specifically means that the surgery involves removing tissue outside the capsule of the parotid gland, typically aimed at excising tumors or other pathological tissues while preserving as much healthy tissue as possible.

What is the appropriate code to use to log a partial parotidectomy in which you perform an extracapsular dissection?

**What is the appropriate code to use to log a partial parotidectomy in which you perform an extracapsular dissection?**

A partial parotidectomy with extracapsular dissection involves surgically removing part of the parotid gland, typically to address a tumor or lesion while preserving other structures within and around the gland. The extracapsular dissection specifically refers to carefully excising tissue outside the capsule of the parotid gland to minimize damage to nearby nerves and structures.
